intro: Iodes oblonga, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It features slender, upright stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Iodes oblonga is often found in association with other moisture-loving plants in its native habitat.
